title: Setup Ruff for linting and formatting
description: Configure Ruff for fast Python linting and code formatting. Setup ruff.toml with rules for code quality, import sorting, and formatting. Include pre-commit hook integration and IDE configuration files.

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Configured Ruff for linting and formatting:

**Configuration (pyproject.toml):**
- Target version: Python 3.10
- Line length: 88 characters
- Indent width: 4 spaces

**Linting Rules Enabled:**
- E/W: pycodestyle errors and warnings
- F: pyflakes
- I: isort (import sorting)
- N: pep8-naming
- UP: pyupgrade (modern Python syntax)
- B: flake8-bugbear (common bugs)
- C4: flake8-comprehensions
- SIM: flake8-simplify
- TCH: flake8-type-checking
- Q: flake8-quotes
- RUF: Ruff-specific rules

**Per-file Ignores:**
- __init__.py: F401 (unused imports)
- tests/*: S101 (use of assert)

**Formatter:**
- Quote style: double
- Indent style: space
- Line ending: auto

**Verification:**
- Ran ruff check --fix on src/: 1 issue fixed (__all__ sorting)
- Ran ruff format on src/: all files already formatted
- All code passes linting and formatting checks
